definition: to deal with and attempt to overcome problems and difficulties
examples: learning to cope with the demands of her schedule

definition: to maintain a contest or combat usually on even terms or with success

examples: The priest wore a cope for the benediction.

definition: something resembling a cope (as by concealing or covering)
to cover or furnish with a cope
to shape (a structural member) to fit a coping or conform to the shape of another member
